alert.note: Alert for Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 10:15PM CDT until May 29 at 11:48AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska...Kansas... Driftwood Creek Near McCook 4sw affecting Red Willow County. Republican River At Mccook 1se affecting Red Willow County. Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson affecting Hitchcock County. Beaver Creek At Cedar Bluffs affecting Decatur and Red Willow Counties. .Flooding continues to be a threat for much of Southwest Nebraska and far Northwest Kansas. Another round of rainfall is approaching the warning area from the west. If additional heavy rainfall occurs, that may lead to another minor rise in river stages late tonight or some time Saturday, especially in Southwest Nebraska. For the Frenchman Creek...including Culbertson...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Republican River At Mccook 1se. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Lowland areas will become flooded. Barnett Park will become inundated. At 10.0 feet, Flooding could become severe in nearby locations. The depth of the water could reach a foot in Barnett Park and other low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM CDT Friday was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.4 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding, and do not drive through flood waters. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1015 AM CDT.
